page.title: 03 GREEN FARM, ROCKHAMPTON
page.content: Green Farm is run by Mr.& Mrs.Childs and one of their 4 sons.It is a 75 acre farm rented from a local landowner.It now concentrates solely on dairying but it used to keep sheep and grow wheat. There are 40 dairy cows and 25 followers.Mr.Childs also keeps some chickens and sells the eggs to a local health food shop.The farm concentrates on dairying because the land is only a few metres above sea level and there is a high water table.The EEC milk quotas have not affected the farm because they produce less than 200,000 litres per annum.However they were affected last year.Modern mechanisation has reduced numbers working in agriculture. Alternative employment has to be found such as the local nuclear power stations.The busiest time of the year is summer when haymaking takes place. Grass is also cut for silage and used
